p: To reduce the volatility and improve aqueous solubility of PREO, 16 oil-in-water (O/W) nanoemulsions of the oil were prepared, as described previously [ 50]. Briefly, different concentrations of TW 20 (2–16%) and ETH 96% (2–32%) were mixed at 600 rpm at room temperature for 5 minutes. Amounts of 11.44 and 12.55 ppm of PREO, equivalent to the calculated percentage of LC 50 values for An. stephensi mysorensis and An. stephensi intermediate, respectively, were added to the TW (as surfactant) and ETH (as co-surfactant) mixture and stirred at the same conditions for 15 min. Subsequently, deionized water was gradually supplemented up to 10 mL and stirred further for 30 min.
